content:
• Tuesday, December 20, 2011
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +7.2% AH after Reuters reports the company turned down takeover...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +7.2% AH after Reuters reports the company turned down takeover overtures from Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and other potential buyers because it prefers to fix its problems on its own. Amazon reportedly hired an investment bank this summer to review a potential merger with RIM, but it didn't make a formal offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • PZZA

    Papa John's (NASDAQ:PZZA) drops 2.1% after establishing 2012 EPS guidance of $2.33-$2.43, below...

    Papa John's (NASDAQ:PZZA) drops 2.1% after establishing 2012 EPS guidance of $2.33-$2.43, below a consensus of $2.47. The pizza chain also expects North American same-store sales growth of just 1.5%-2.5%, and international same-store sales growth of 1.5%-3.5%. The 2012 figures are outweighing an increase in the company's 2011 EPS guidance range to $2.15-$2.20, from a prior $2.08-$2.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • ORCL

    It looks as if Europe's troubles finally caught up to Oracle. A look at its FQ3 report reveals...

    It looks as if Europe's troubles finally caught up to Oracle. A look at its FQ3 report reveals sales to EMEA region grew less than 1% Y/Y during the quarter, after increasing at a 14% clip in FQ1. Sales growth for the Americas also saw a decline - up only 2% in FQ2 compared with 8% in the prior quarter. Asia-Pac sales grew at a healthy 8% clip, but only accounted for 17% of revenue. ORCL -9.3% AH. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) drops 4% AH, giving back some of today's big gains, after disclosing in...

    OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) drops 4% AH, giving back some of today's big gains, after disclosing in an 8-K that executive chairman and former CEO Jeffrey Jordan has resigned. Jordan, who took a position at VC firm Andreessen Horowitz in May, will continue to serve as a member of OpenTable's board.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • ORCL

    Some major enterprise software names are trading lower following Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ2 miss...

    Some major enterprise software names are trading lower following Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ2 miss (I, II). SAP -2.7%. CRM -1.4%. IBM -1.3%. HPQ -1.6%. Given Oracle's reputation as a "safe harbor" during times of macro weakness, concerns about slowing IT spending will likely be on many investors' minds tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • ORCL

    More on Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ2: New software license revenue up 2% Y/Y, down sharply from...

    More on Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) FQ2: New software license revenue up 2% Y/Y, down sharply from FQ1's 17% growth (.pdf). Software license update and product support revenue up 9%, down from FQ1's 16%. Hardware revenue fell 14%, worse than FQ1's 5%. Services revenue flat Y/Y, down from FQ1's 10% growth. Sales of high-end Exadata and Exalogic systems grew strongly. A new $5B stock buyback has been authorized. ORCL -7.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • CVS

    CVS Caremark (CVS +9.2%) shares obviously benefit from its predicted double-digit profit...

    CVS Caremark (CVS +9.2%) shares obviously benefit from its predicted double-digit profit increase in 2012 and 30% dividend hike, but it also touts the success of MinuteClinic, a wave of generics that is seen boosting profitability the next several years and customer wins if a contract spat between Walgreen (WAG) and Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) continues into 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF +23.3%) shares surge as the firm's FQ4 report shows its total balance sheet...

    Jefferies (JEF +23.3%) shares surge as the firm's FQ4 report shows its total balance sheet reduced by nearly one-fourth and leverage lowered to 9.9x from 12.9x. A further boost comes as critic Sean Egan says he'll back off a request that JEF raise $1B in equity: "We'll see how the things look after they release the 10-K, but reducing assets by a significant number is very helpful."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis (PERY +2.4%) trades higher after Standpoint Research ups the stock to Buy on...

    Perry Ellis (PERY +2.4%) trades higher after Standpoint Research ups the stock to Buy on valuation, saying the stock's weakness presents a buying opportunity. Standpoint says the company's design issues - which caused its recent selloff - will be fixed in 2012, leaving the stock poised for a recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD +3%) moves up after S&P raises the chance of an upgrade, citing the company's...

    Pall (PLL-OLD +3%) moves up after S&P raises the chance of an upgrade, citing the company's improved credit metrics and strong operating performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +6.8%) gets a boost after a report by Barclays puts it at one of...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +6.8%) gets a boost after a report by Barclays puts it at one of its top seven retail sector picks, saying the maker of teen apparel should benefit from the closing of unprofitable stores, expense leveraging and an improvement to its margin due to lower costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • XHB

    Homebuilding stocks (XHB +5%) continue to climb in reaction to rising housing starts, but much...

    Homebuilding stocks (XHB +5%) continue to climb in reaction to rising housing starts, but much of the report's strength was due to a three-year high in multifamily starts. "The report doesn’t signal any turn in fortunes for the lion’s share of the market: single family homes," Miller Tabak's Andrew Wilkinson says. "The level of activity there rose by just 10,000 units to a 447,000 annualized pace."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZAGG

    It's high drama for Zagg (ZAGG -3.4%) after its CEO takes the offensive against claims from Jim...

    It's high drama for Zagg (ZAGG -3.4%) after its CEO takes the offensive against claims from Jim Cramer that the firm's products are "ridiculously easy" to duplicate. He says Zagg's invisibleSHIELD product continues to decrease as an overall percentage of sales as it develops new products, and notes that Verizon and AT&T are picking up new lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • AGCO

    AGCO (AGCO +3.7%) trades up after Credit Suisse raised its estimates earlier today, citing a...

    AGCO (AGCO +3.7%) trades up after Credit Suisse raised its estimates earlier today, citing a much more upbeat outlook following the company's analyst day last week. FY2012 and 2013 EPS estimates are raised to $4.80 and $4.50 respectively, reflecting the operational headway the company has made.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • OGE

    OGE Energy (OGE +3.9%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Jefferies, citing higher expected earnings...

    OGE Energy (OGE +3.9%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Jefferies, citing higher expected earnings following the EPA's release of its regional haze "Federal Implementation Plan."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CHTR

    Charter (CHTR +5%) is posting a healthy gain a day after it was learned ex-Cablevision (CVC...

    Charter (CHTR +5%) is posting a healthy gain a day after it was learned ex-Cablevision (CVC +3.8%) COO Tom Rutledge parted company with the Dolan family in order to become Charter's CEO. Meanwhile, BTIG is downgrading Cablevision to Neutral, believing "something really bad transpired" between Rutledge and CEO James Dolan, and that investors need clarity regarding the details.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • EMN

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +8.3%) shares jump a day after announcing it had broken ground on a new...

    Eastman Chemical (EMN +8.3%) shares jump a day after announcing it had broken ground on a new facility to produce acetate in China. The new plant is part of a joint venture with China National Tobacco Corp. and will produce 30,000 metric tons of acetate tow upon completion.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +33.2%) surges after the company joins BP, Total (NYSE:TOT), Eni (NYSE:E),...

    Cobalt Energy (CIE +33.2%) surges after the company joins BP, Total (NYSE:TOT), Eni (NYSE:E), Statoil (STO), and Repsol (OTCQX:REPYF) in signing deals with Angola's government to explore for oil off the country's coast. Shares took off last week after a Diamond Offshore (NYSE:DO) 8-K disclosure fueled hopes that a deal was imminent.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • KLAC

    KLA Tencor (KLAC +5.7%) gains after being upgraded to Overweight and its price target raised to...

    KLA Tencor (KLAC +5.7%) gains after being upgraded to Overweight and its price target raised to $52 from $43 at JPMorgan. The firm says chip-industry fundamentals "are troughing" and the capital equipment space is "poised for a turnaround" next quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • ATRS

    Antares Pharma (AIS +5.8%) moves higher today after announcing it's inked an agreement with...

    Antares Pharma (AIS +5.8%) moves higher today after announcing it's inked an agreement with Pfizer's consumer healthcare unit to license one of its drug delivery technologies for the development of an undisclosed product on an exclusive basis for distribution in North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • HMC

    Honda (HMC +3.5%) expects U.S. sales to jump up 23% in 2012 with dealer inventories getting...

    Honda (HMC +3.5%) expects U.S. sales to jump up 23% in 2012 with dealer inventories getting restocked to normal levels following this year due to natural disasters. The carmaker is in recovery mode after its U.S. market share fell off to 9% from 10.5% and the just-released Civic model was blasted by critics.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • CIEN

    A day after issuing a downbeat outlook for telecom equipment makers, Morgan Stanley's Ehud...

    A day after issuing a downbeat outlook for telecom equipment makers, Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum suggests the end of AT&T/T-Mobile is a positive for the group, given investors feared the deal would lead to capex cuts. Ciena (CIEN +10.1%), Juniper (JNPR +9.6%), and Adtran (ADTN (ADTN +8.9%), whom Gelblum singles out as being "exposed to AT&T," are all posting big gains. (UBS comments)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • MELI

    Latin American online auctioneer MercadoLibre (MELI +3.1%) gains after Credit Suisse intitiates...

    Latin American online auctioneer MercadoLibre (MELI +3.1%) gains after Credit Suisse intitiates the stock with a Neutral rating, noting that despite its high valuation it remains one of the best long-term secular share growth stories on the Internet.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • TYL

    Information management solutions provider Tyler Technologies (TYL +3.5%) moves higher after...

    Information management solutions provider Tyler Technologies (TYL +3.5%) moves higher after signing agreements with five counties in Texas to implement its Land & Vital Records solution, which encompasses a suite of services including licensing, related professional services, maintenance and support.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • MYL

    Mylan (MYL +3.5%) says one of its subsidiaries has received approval for three antiretroviral...

    Mylan (MYL +3.5%) says one of its subsidiaries has received approval for three antiretroviral therapies used to treat HIV/AIDS under the World Health Organization's Prequalification of Medicines Program.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • CBIO

    Targacept (TRGT -32.1%) catches the eye of analysts a bit late after the firm bombs with Phase...

    Targacept (TRGT -32.1%) catches the eye of analysts a bit late after the firm bombs with Phase III clinical results for its antidepressant drug-candidate TC-5214. Leerink Swann downgrades shares to Market Perform from Outperform, while Global Hunter takes its rating down to Neutral from Accumulate.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CELL

    Brightpoint (CELL +4.4%) says it's signed a distribution deal with Research in Motion to expand...

    Brightpoint (CELL +4.4%) says it's signed a distribution deal with Research in Motion to expand the availability of BlackBerry smartphones and software in Bosnia, Albania, Macedonia and Serbia.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • OSGB

    Shipping stocks get a lift today as better-than-expected economic data out of Germany and some...

    Shipping stocks get a lift today as better-than-expected economic data out of Germany and some encouraging housing data out of the U.S. spark hopes for light at the end of the tunnel: Overseas Shipholding (OSG +6.4%), Frontline (FRO +4.9%), Ship Finance (SFL +4.2%), Knightsbridge Tankers (VLCCF +2.4%) and Teekay (TNK +1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +2.9%) rises on its patent victory, but would-be loser Google (GOOG +1.3%) also...

    Apple (AAPL +2.9%) rises on its patent victory, but would-be loser Google (GOOG +1.3%) also moves up, and analysts are mindful that AAPL didn’t get all it wanted as far as specific claims. The ruling is a “small dent against Android in the grand scheme of the smartphone patent wars," RBC writes; it "won’t disrupt at all... HTC’s and Android’s business," Sanford Bernstein says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +5.3%) and MetroPCS (PCS +3.8%) are part of the sizable list of names (I,...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +5.3%) and MetroPCS (PCS +3.8%) are part of the sizable list of names (I, II, III) rallying thanks to the official end to AT&T's (T +1.2%) attempt to acquire T-Mobile. Investors apparently feel the benefits of not having AT&T swallow up a rival outweigh the value that would have been provided by the spectrum sales AT&T planned to make to the discount carriers in order to secure the deal's passage.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.3%) isn't joining in on today's rally after Piper's Nicole Miller...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -1.3%) isn't joining in on today's rally after Piper's Nicole Miller Regan trims her FY13 (ends Sep. 2013) EPS estimate, citing slower-than-expected sales growth for Green Mountain's K-Cups. However, Regan believes sales of Starbucks' (SBUX +3.1%) Via single-serve coffee product are performing well, which leads her to lift her 2012 EPS estimate for the coffee chain. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +5.6%) says it's increasing its spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled...

    AK Steel (AKS +5.6%) says it's increasing its spot market base prices for all carbon flat-rolled steel products by $50 per ton, effective immediately with all new orders.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +2.1%) announces the filing of an Investigational New Drug application with...

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +2.1%) announces the filing of an Investigational New Drug application with the FDA for ONT-10, a therapeutic vaccine directed at cancers expressing MUC1. Upon completion of the review, expects to initiate a Phase 1 trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CGEN

    Compugen (CGEN +3.1%) announces that it will "significantly" broaden its monoclonal antibody...

    Compugen (CGEN +3.1%) announces that it will "significantly" broaden its monoclonal antibody program and will establish preclinical development capabilities in-house instead of using third parties. The firm will take on $8M in funding from Israel-based Baize Investments to help move along its research program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +8.1%) rallies after Credit Suisse starts coverage with an Outperform and $49...

    OpenTable (OPEN +8.1%) rallies after Credit Suisse starts coverage with an Outperform and $49 PT. The firm notes OpenTable's valuation has declined (though at 28.7x estimated 2012 EPS, it's still steep), and thinks the company still has plenty of room to grow in North America, given its service only accounts for 17% of seated diners. (Morgan Keegan)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • RMD

    ResMed (RMD +4.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Strong Buy on valuation at Feltl. The firm...

    ResMed (RMD +4.8%) trades higher on an upgrade to Strong Buy on valuation at Feltl. The firm says the stock is trading at historic lows on a P/E basis, and the last time the stock traded below 13x forward P/E - as it is now - it rallied over 100% during the following year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • DELL

    S&P lifts its rating on EMC (EMC +2.4%) to Strong Buy and boosts its target price by a...

    S&P lifts its rating on EMC (EMC +2.4%) to Strong Buy and boosts its target price by a dollar to $28. It thinks "EMC will be one of the biggest beneficiaries of the continued growth of enterprise storage," which IDC expects will see volume shipment growth of 47%/year through 2015. Gaining market share in high-end IT, S&P sees EMC also "making inroads in the mid-tier market with its VNX unified storage product lines."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUAN

    Nuance Communications (NUAN +5%) acquires Vlingo, developer of the Virtual Assistant, which uses...

    Nuance Communications (NUAN +5%) acquires Vlingo, developer of the Virtual Assistant, which uses voice to text technology and intelligent voice interface processing, for an undisclosed sum. The company hopes to capitalize on explosive market demand for virtual assistant and voice-enabled capabilities spanning phones, tablets, cars, televisions, navigation devices, music players, PCs and more, and estimates market demand to be near $5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • BB

    On a day when everything is rising, Research In Motion (RIMM -1.4%) continues its "long, slow...

    On a day when everything is rising, Research In Motion (RIMM -1.4%) continues its "long, slow death spiral," falling to new eight-year lows. As Therese Poletti puts it: "It may take awhile, but RIM seems to be clearly headed in the same direction as Palm, towards eventual extinction, unless its board of directors does something soon to change its direction."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • ALV

    Shares of Autoliv (ALV +5.7%) perk up after the auto industry supplier elects a new Chairman of...

    Shares of Autoliv (ALV +5.7%) perk up after the auto industry supplier elects a new Chairman of the Board and declares a continuation of its $0.45/share quarterly dividend.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • EW

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.2%) moves higher on an RBC upgrade to its Top Pick list. The firm...

    Edwards Lifesciences (EW +3.2%) moves higher on an RBC upgrade to its Top Pick list. The firm cites the potential of its TAVR program, plus expectations for a positive outcome in its upcoming July, 2012 FDA advisory panel.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • T

    Speculation on a potential AT&T (NYSE:T) bid for Dish Networks (DISH +8%) intensifies after...

    Speculation on a potential AT&T (NYSE:T) bid for Dish Networks (DISH +8%) intensifies after AT&T's deal collapse, aided by a Stifel Nicolaus report raising the possibility that Dish "could very well be the next target for AT&T... We believe Charlie Ergen realizes he is unlikely to ever get a better offer than from a moderately-desperate AT&T that needs spectrum and needs it quickly."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 2 Comments
  • AB

    AllianceBernstein (AB +3.4%) gets a boost after announcing some organizational changes as part...

    AllianceBernstein (AB +3.4%) gets a boost after announcing some organizational changes as part of its effort to streamline management and improve performance. James Gingrich, the leader of its sell-side research subsidiary, will be assuming the role of COO, while Robert M. Keith, co-manager of institutional and retail distribution, will become head of client service, sales and marketing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM

  • Crude futures (+3% to $96.67) rallying after being oversold but also receiving support from a...

    Crude futures (+3% to $96.67) rallying after being oversold but also receiving support from a variety of sources: the strong housing data, unrest in an oil-producing province of Kazakhstan, and a meeting of world leaders in Rome to discuss Iranian oil sanctions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • LEN

    Home builders (XHB +4.2%) rally on news that housing starts hit their highest annual rate since...

    Home builders (XHB +4.2%) rally on news that housing starts hit their highest annual rate since April 2010, and reinforcing recent numbers showing gains in builder sentiment and increases in sale prices: LEN +4.9%, DHI +4.8%, PHM +7%, TOL +5.4%, RYL +4.6%, KBH +5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (RHT -7.6%) continues to sell off after delivering soft top-line figures in its FQ3...

    Red Hat (RHT -7.6%) continues to sell off after delivering soft top-line figures in its FQ3 report (I, II) and issuing mixed FQ4 guidance. Not helping matters is a downgrade to Neutral from BofA, which is concerned about the market's reaction to decelerating growth. However,  Oppenheimer (Outperform) still thinks Red Hat is "well positioned to generate 15-20% billing growth" going forward. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • LL

    Shares of Lumber Liquidators (LL +7.6%) get a major boost from a Collins Stewart upgrade to Buy...

    Shares of Lumber Liquidators (LL +7.6%) get a major boost from a Collins Stewart upgrade to Buy from. Analysts with the firm ring in the highest FY12 EPS estimate on the Street - slotting in 38% earnings growth on the strength of easy upcoming comps and benefits from sourcing improvements.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI +5.5%) wins a $640M three-year contract to drill 60 wells in Iraq's southern...

    Baker Hughes (BHI +5.5%) wins a $640M three-year contract to drill 60 wells in Iraq's southern Zubair oilfield. ENI (E +3%), Occidental (OXY +4.2%) and South Korea's KOGAS sign a 20-year deal to develop Zubair, which has an eventual output target of 1.2M barrels/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • CCI

    Jefferies sees tower companies as winners from AT&T's dropped bid for T-Mobile, set to...

    Jefferies sees tower companies as winners from AT&T's dropped bid for T-Mobile, set to "rally on the prospect of the U.S. national wireless market not contracting to three players from four." Chances rise that deep pockets will provide business to some of the entities with alternative sources of spectrum, Jefferies adds. CCI +2.9%, AMT +3.7%, SBAC +3.5%, FTWR +6.8%, TWER +4.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • WNS

    Shares of WNS Holdings (WNS +9.9%) go on a tear, extending a rally started yesterday after the...

    Shares of WNS Holdings (WNS +9.9%) go on a tear, extending a rally started yesterday after the offshore business processing firm landed an upgrade from Baird to Outperform along a new price objective of $13.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • CELL

    Canaccord's Mike Walkley sees the unraveling of AT&T's bid to acquire T-Mobile as a positive...

    Canaccord's Mike Walkley sees the unraveling of AT&T's bid to acquire T-Mobile as a positive for phone logistics provider Brightpoint (CELL +3.6%), given T-Mobile is a major Brightpoint customer, and its continued existence as an independent carrier translates into better 2012 visibility. Moreover, Walkley expects growing global smartphone sales to give a lift to Brightpoint's distribution business. (more on AT&T)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • IPAR

    Inter Parfums (IPAR -7.8%) declines sharply after disclosing that it's in discussions with...

    Inter Parfums (IPAR -7.8%) declines sharply after disclosing that it's in discussions with Burberry Group regarding the establishment of a new operating structure for the Burberry fragrance and beauty business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • PBH

    Shares of Prestige Holdings (NYSE:PBH) double up on a healthy premarket gain, and now stand...

    Shares of Prestige Holdings (NYSE:PBH) double up on a healthy premarket gain, and now stand 15.2% higher following the firm's acquisition of 17 consumer OTC brands from GlaxoSmithKline.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • YZC

    Trading in shares of Yanzhou Coal (YZC -1.5%) is halted pending a news announcement. The focus...

    Trading in shares of Yanzhou Coal (YZC -1.5%) is halted pending a news announcement. The focus on the company has been ongoing talk that it will acquire Australia's Gloucester Coal in a multi-billion dollar deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) +5% premarket after a report that LightSquared, the broadband wireless company...

    Clearwire (CLWR) +5% premarket after a report that LightSquared, the broadband wireless company backed by Philip Falcone, could run out of cash as soon as Q2 2012. CLWR is trying to reposition itself as a provider of LTE capacity for the major carriers, effectively competing with LightSquared for wholesale customers. Plus, as AT&T's failed bid for T-Mobile helps Sprint, it helps CLWR.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 2 Comments
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE) gains 6.5% after scoring a deal to provide its Grid Battery System to...

    A123 Systems (AONE) gains 6.5% after scoring a deal to provide its Grid Battery System to Hawaiian utility Maui Electric. The system is designed to provide 1MW of power for an hour, so as to reduce the peak energy load for one of Maui's transformers. 27.7% of A123's float was shorted as of Nov. 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival (NYSE:CCL) move 1.2% lower premarket after the firm delivers in-line earnings...

    Shares of Carnival (NYSE:CCL) move 1.2% lower premarket after the firm delivers in-line earnings with its FQ4 report. The cruise line operator says it expects Q1 EPS to fall in a $0.06-$0.10 range, after adjusting for a steep $93M Y/Y increase in fuel costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • KBR

    Engineering/construction services firm KBR gains 3.8% after establishing 2012 EPS guidance of...

    Engineering/construction services firm KBR gains 3.8% after establishing 2012 EPS guidance of $2.45-$2.80 ($2.66 Street consensus). The company is also reaffirming its 2012 revenue guidance of $300M-$500M for services provided in support of the Army's LogCAP program.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • BAC

    Bank shares move higher premarket, boosted by favorable news from Europe (I, II) and a strong...

    Bank shares move higher premarket, boosted by favorable news from Europe (I, II) and a strong quarter from Jefferies. BofA (NYSE:BAC) will be watched after yesterday's close just below $5, a mark beyond which some money managers might have to sell the stock. Will the bank’s defenders - including big institutions such as BRK.A, JPM and C - be able to reclaim the $5 handle? BAC +2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • TLB

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) responds to a standing offer from Sycamore Partners to buy the firm at...

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB) responds to a standing offer from Sycamore Partners to buy the firm at $3/share, saying that it concludes the price was "inadequate" and substantially undervalues the firm. The Talbot board says it will explore a full range of "strategic alternatives." Shares +3.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
